canDo: I can talk about past events and tell simple stories.

grammar.point: Simple Past Tense (regular and irregular verbs)

rules.title: Regular verbs: add -ed
rules.explanation: For regular verbs, add -ed to the base form: walk -> walked, play -> played, watch -> watched.
examples: We watched a movie last night.
rules.koreanTip: 규칙 동사는 -ed만 붙이면 되지만, 발음이 /t/, /d/, /id/로 달라져요. 'walked'는 /t/, 'played'는 /d/, 'wanted'는 /id/로 발음해요.

rules.title: Irregular verbs: memorize forms
rules.explanation: Irregular verbs have special past forms: go -> went, eat -> ate, see -> saw, have -> had.
rules.koreanTip: 불규칙 동사는 외워야 해요! go-went, eat-ate, see-saw, have-had, take-took, make-made 등을 꼭 기억하세요.

rules.title: Negative and questions with did
rules.explanation: Use 'did not (didn't)' for negatives and 'Did...?' for questions. The main verb returns to base form.
examples: I didn't go to work yesterday.
rules.koreanTip: 부정문과 의문문에서는 'did'를 쓰고, 동사는 원형으로 돌아가요! 'Did you went?' (X) -> 'Did you go?' (O)

exercises.question: I ___ (go) to the beach last summer.
exercises.explanation: 'Go' is an irregular verb. The past form is 'went'.

exercises.question: She ___ (watch) TV for two hours yesterday.
exercises.explanation: 'Watch' is a regular verb. Add -ed to make it past tense.

exercises.question: They ___ (not/eat) dinner at home last night.
exercises.explanation: Use 'didn't' + base form for past negative.
exercises.koreanTip: 과거 부정문은 'didn't + 동사원형'이에요. 'didn't ate'는 틀린 표현이에요.

words.koreanTip: 과거 시제와 함께 자주 쓰이는 시간 표현

examples: I visited my grandmother last week.
words.koreanTip: last + 시간 표현으로 '지난 ~'을 나타내요 (last month, last year)

examples: I moved here two years ago.
She called me an hour ago.
words.koreanTip: '시간 + ago'로 '~ 전에'를 표현해요. 문장 끝에 위치해요.
이야기에서 긴장감을 더할 때 자주 사용해요

words.meaning: at the end, after a long time
examples: We finally arrived at the hotel.
words.koreanTip: 이야기의 결말이나 오래 기다린 결과를 말할 때 써요

reading.title: My Trip to Jeju Island
reading.passage: Last summer, I went to Jeju Island with my family. We stayed at a hotel near the beach for five days. On the first day, we visited Seongsan Ilchulbong. The view was amazing! We took many photos. On the second day, we swam in the sea. The water was cold but refreshing. We also ate delicious seafood for dinner. On the last day, it suddenly started to rain. We couldn't go outside, so we stayed at the hotel and played board games. Finally, we came back home. It was a wonderful trip, and I want to go again next year.

questions.question: How long did they stay at the hotel?
questions.explanation: The passage says 'We stayed at a hotel near the beach for five days.'

questions.question: What did they do when it rained on the last day?
options: They stayed at the hotel and played board games
questions.correctAnswer: They stayed at the hotel and played board games
questions.explanation: The passage says 'we stayed at the hotel and played board games.'

questions.question: What does 'refreshing' mean in this passage?
options: Making you feel fresh and energetic
questions.correctAnswer: Making you feel fresh and energetic
questions.explanation: 'Refreshing' means something that makes you feel fresh and full of energy.

listening.title: A Memorable Day
listening.script: Let me tell you about my most memorable day. It was my birthday last year. I woke up early in the morning. My family surprised me with a beautiful cake. We ate breakfast together and then went to an amusement park. I rode many exciting rides. In the evening, my friends came to my house. We had a party and danced until midnight. It was the best birthday ever!

exercises.question: What did the speaker's family surprise them with?
exercises.explanation: The speaker says 'My family surprised me with a beautiful cake.'

exercises.question: They danced until ___.
exercises.explanation: The speaker says 'We had a party and danced until midnight.'

template.prompt: Write about your last vacation using the template.
template.template: Last [TIME], I went to [PLACE]. I stayed there for [DURATION]. First, I [ACTIVITY1]. Then, I [ACTIVITY2]. Finally, I [ACTIVITY3]. It was a [ADJECTIVE] experience!
template.correctExample: Last summer, I went to Busan. I stayed there for three days. First, I swam in the sea. Then, I ate delicious seafood. Finally, I visited Haeundae Beach. It was a wonderful experience!

free.topic: Tell a Story About Your Weekend
free.prompt: Write about what you did last weekend. Include at least 5 past tense verbs and use time expressions like 'first', 'then', 'finally'.

checklist.item: Use at least 5 past tense verbs

shadowing.sentence: Last weekend, I went to the movies with my friends. We watched an action movie and ate popcorn.
shadowing.pronunciation: /læst ˈwiːkend aɪ went tuː ðə ˈmuːviz wɪð maɪ frendz wiː wɑːtʃt ən ˈækʃən ˈmuːvi ænd et ˈpɑːpkɔːrn/

roleplay.scenario: You are telling a friend about your vacation.

prompts.speaker: user
prompts.text: It was great! I went to ___.

prompts.speaker: partner
prompts.text: Nice! What did you do there?

prompts.speaker: partner
prompts.text: That sounds fun! Did you eat anything special?

prompts.speaker: user
prompts.text: Yes, I ate ___. It was delicious!

koreanErrors.explanation: 'Go' is an irregular verb. The past tense is 'went', not 'goed'.
koreanErrors.tip: 'go'는 불규칙 동사예요. 'goed'가 아니라 'went'입니다. 불규칙 동사 목록을 외워두세요!

koreanErrors.explanation: After 'did', use the base form of the verb, not the past tense.
koreanErrors.tip: 'Did' 뒤에는 항상 동사 원형이 와요. 'Did you went?'가 아니라 'Did you go?'입니다.

koreanErrors.explanation: When talking about past events, use past tense verbs.
koreanErrors.tip: 'yesterday'처럼 과거를 나타내는 말이 있으면 동사도 과거형으로 바꿔야 해요!
